titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Irene Haupt Photographs of June in Buffalo, 2014
Haupt (Irene) Photographs of June in Buffalo 2014
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library
publicationstmt.p: © 2014. State University of New York at Buffalo. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley, December 2014.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Irene Haupt Photographs of June in Buffalo, 2014
did.langmaterial: No textual content in the collection.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: Contains 180 digital images of musicians who participated in the June in Buffalo 2014 at the University at Buffalo, including guest composers Joshua Fineberg, Stephen Hartke, Philippe Hurel, Hilda Paredes, and Bernard Rands.

note.p: All files in the collection were renamed to reflect chronological sequence. Original filenames stated in the container list are transcribed as stated on the DVDs as received. Renamed files stored in the Institutional Repository.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Irene Haupt Photographs of June in Buffalo, 2014, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p: The entire collection of images from June in Buffalo 2014 is available in University at Buffalo Libraries Digital Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Irene Haupt, a graduate of the State University of New York at Buffalo, has been documenting the Buffalo arts scene through her photography since 1976. During that time she has worked for, or with, some of the most notable institutions in Buffalo, including the Irish Classical Theatre, Studio Arena Theater, the Kavinoky Theatre, the Buffalo Philharmonic Orchestra, the Theatre of Youth, the Albright-Knox Art Gallery, and the State University of New York at Buffalo. In addition to her specialty of theater photography, Irene Haupt has also devoted much of her career to the photography of musicians and musical events. Most notable is her documentation of the contemporary music scene in Buffalo, including coverage of the University at Buffalo's June in Buffalo festival of new music, 1982-1987, and 2000 to the present. Over the course of those years, she has created a visual record that contains images of some of the most significant composers and performers of the last quarter century. The list of names is impressive: Aaron Copland, Morton Feldman, Leo Smit, Virgil Thomson, Steve Reich, Ralph Shapey, Henry Brant, Earle Brown, Ursula Oppens, Jan Williams, Lukas Foss, Philip Glass, Otto Luening, Conlon Nancarrow, Ernst Krenek, Larry Austin, Lejaren Hiller, Elliott Carter, Milton Babbitt, John Cage, Charles Wuorinen, Jacob Druckman, and Yvar Mikhashoff, among others.

The June in Buffalo festival of contemporary music was begun at the University at Buffalo in 1975 by composer Morton Feldman. He directed the festival 1975-1978 and in 1980. The festival was dormant from 1981 through 1985. David Felder revived the festival in 1986 and has been its director since that time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection of Irene Haupt Photographs of June in Buffalo 2014 contains 180 digital images of participants in the festival for 2014. The list of musicians includes guest composers Joshua Fineberg, Stephen Hartke, Philippe Hurel, Hilda Paredes, and Bernard Rands. Performers include Irvine Arditti, Brad Lubman, Julia Bentley, Nicholas Isherwood, Steven Beck, Marianne Gythfeldt, Tom Kolor, Yuki Numata Resnick, Emi Ferguson, JoAnn Falletta, and Jerry Hou. Ensembles include Ensemble Court-Circuit, Signal Ensemble, Norrbotten NEO, the Slee Sinfonietta, and the Buffalo Philharmonic Orchestra.
